events.originalText: The Soviet nuclear-powered satellite Kosmos 954 burned up during atmospheric reentry, scattering radioactive debris across Canada's Northwest Territories.
events.subtitle: Nuclear power
events.headline: Soviet satellite Kosmos 954 scatters radioactive debris over Canada

events.originalText: During the Spanish transition to democracy, neo-fascists attacked an office in Madrid, killing five people and injuring four others.
events.subtitle: Spanish transition to democracy
events.headline: Neo-fascists attack office in Madrid, killing five during Spanish transition to democracy

events.originalText: Japanese soldier Shoichi Yokoi was found in the jungles of Guam, where he had been hiding since the end of World War II.
events.subtitle: Shoichi Yokoi
events.headline: Japanese soldier Shoichi Yokoi found in Guam jungle after hiding since WWII

events.originalText: Vietnam War: The 1st Australian Task Force launched Operation Coburg against the North Vietnamese army and the Viet Cong.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: 1st Australian Task Force launches Operation Coburg in Vietnam War

events.originalText: Air India Flight 101, en route from Bombay to London, crashed into Mont Blanc in France, killing all 117 people on board.
events.subtitle: Air India Flight 101
events.headline: Air India Flight 101 crashes into Mont Blanc, killing all 117 on board

events.originalText: First World War: British ships of the Grand Fleet intercepted and surprised a German High Seas Fleet squadron in the North Sea, sinking a cruiser and damaging several other vessels.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: British Grand Fleet sinks German High Seas Fleet squadron in North Sea

events.originalText: Greek military aviators Michael Moutoussis and Aristeidis Moraitinis performed the first naval air mission in history, with a Farman MF.7 hydroplane.
events.subtitle: Michael Moutoussis
events.headline: Greek aviators perform first naval air mission in history

events.originalText: The University of Calcutta  was established as the first modern university in the Indian subcontinent.
events.subtitle: University of Calcutta
events.headline: University of Calcutta established as first modern university in Indian subcontinent

events.originalText: James W. Marshall discovered gold at Sutter's Mill in Coloma, California, leading to the California gold rush.
events.subtitle: James W. Marshall
events.headline: Gold discovered at Sutter's Mill in California, sparking gold rush

events.originalText: King Henry VIII of England (pictured) suffered a serious accident while jousting, receiving injuries which may have caused his later obesity and erratic personality.
events.subtitle: Henry VIII
events.headline: King Henry VIII suffers serious jousting accident

events.originalText: The Estates unanimously proclaimed 14-year-old Matthias Corvinus King of Hungary after being persuaded to do so by his uncle Michael Szilágyi.
events.subtitle: Estates of the realm
events.headline: Estates proclaim 14-year-old Matthias Corvinus King of Hungary

events.originalText: The Fatimid Caliphate began their first invasion of Egypt, against the Abbasids, which eventually ended in failure.
events.subtitle: Fatimid Caliphate
events.headline: Fatimid Caliphate begins first invasion of Egypt against Abbasids

events.originalText: Kʼakʼ Tiliw Chan Yopaat dedicated a 65-ton stele, the largest stone known to be quarried by the Maya civilization, at his city of Quiriguá.
events.subtitle: Kʼakʼ Tiliw Chan Yopaat
events.headline: Maya ruler dedicates 65-ton stele at Quiriguá

events.originalText: Cassius Chaerea and disgruntled members of the Praetorian Guard murdered the Roman emperor Caligula, who was succeeded by his uncle Claudius.
events.subtitle: AD 41
events.headline: Roman emperor Caligula murdered by Praetorian Guard, succeeded by Claudius
